forecast.name: Tonight

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon gives way to a whisper of rain, as clouds drape the skyline in a shroud of silvery gray. With temperatures hovering in the low sixties, a gentle breeze stirs from the southeast, beckoning those infatuated with the brisk scent of impending showers. The forecast suggests a 20% chance of precipitation—though the atmosphere is thick with the promise of moisture, hinting at a more substantial arrival of rain tonight, when the odds of downpour climb to a more assertive 70%.

As daylight dwindles, the visibility across the bay is softened by a delicate veil of fog, where the familiar silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge melds into the horizon. The marine layer lingers, gracefully obscuring the vibrant hues typical of a clear day, instead replacing them with a tranquil, muted palette. Such conditions offer an invitation to dress comfortably—light layers will suffice, perhaps a waterproof jacket for the evening kiss of rain that is ready to awaken the city’s scent of wet pavement and foliage. In this moment, a leisurely walk through the fog-laden streets might provide a perfect respite; perhaps a visit to one of the local coffee shops, where the steam mingles in the air, bringing warmth not just to the body, but to the spirit on this quietly introspective day.
